kemet framework.title: Kemet Framework
kemet framework.description: KEMET is a comprehensive red teaming framework designed to automate offensive cybersecurity operations while maintaining stealth and precision. The platform features a clean, user-friendly interface that enables professionals to conduct complex simulations with ease.

teamLeader.name: Andrew Mamdouh
teamLeader.role: Cyber Security Leader | malware dev | Pentester

anubis.title: ANUBIS
anubis.description:
This project aims to develop a multi-platform application—available on desktop, web, and mobile—that highlights the cultural and historical heritage of ancient Egypt. By combining authentic historical content with modern artificial intelligence technologies, the application seeks to bridge the gap between the past and the present in an engaging and accessible way.

At the core of the app lies a deep respect for Egypt's ancient civilizations. It provides users with concise, informative overviews of Egypt's ancient kingdoms, along with guides to major archaeological sites and regional tourist attractions. These resources are designed not only to educate but also to promote cultural tourism and appreciation of Egypt's rich legacy.

One of the app's standout features is "Chat Anubis", a multilingual chatbot that supports 59 languages and 117 dialects. This ensures that users from all over the world can interact with the app in their native language, making the experience inclusive and user-friendly.

In addition, the app employs Computer Vision technology to recognize pharaoh statues and other artifacts. Upon recognition, it provides users with detailed historical context, enhancing the interactive experience and making learning about history feel intuitive and personal.

Ultimately, this application represents a fusion of heritage and innovation. It brings the story of ancient Egypt to life through a seamless blend of culture, technology, and design—making the wonders of the past relevant and accessible to today's global audience.

media-track.title: Media track
media-track.description: A web application for booking hospitals, laboratories, and pharmacies that saves users a lot of time. It also allows them to keep their medical records stored on their account, including test results, scans, and everything else uploaded, so they can access them anytime in case they forget.

smart-city.title: Smart City
smart-city.description:
This project presents a small-scale prototype of a Smart City that utilizes modern technologies such as the Internet of Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), and various sensors. The model integrates multiple smart systems including traffic control, energy management, security, and smart lighting to create a more efficient and comfortable living environment.

Project Components:

ESP32 Microcontroller

Ultrasonic sensors for managing city and garage gates

IR sensors to detect vehicle presence

Servo motors for automatic gate control

LCD screens to display welcome and goodbye messages

Smart lighting that activates based on motion or ambient light
teamMembers: Seif El-Din Khaled Abdullah.... Mohamed Saeed Abdel Aziz.... Youssef Samir Bakhit.... Mariam Mohamed Jalal.... Menna Allah Safwat Soliman

wifi-attack.title: Wifi attack
wifi-attack.description: A tool that hacks Wi-Fi and has a GUI. It hacks Wi-Fi in all ways and easily using buttons. It also performs all attacks that can be done when you are on the same network or post-hacking attacks until you reach the point of hacking the devices on the network.

network-detection-system.title: Network Detection System
network-detection-system.description: The project aims to create a simulation system through which cyber penetrations can be made, which helps in learning and benefiting by using technologies.

deepsec.title: DeepSec
deepsec.description: DeepSec is a smart, real-time Intrusion Detection and Prevention System (IDPS) designed to monitor, detect, classify, and respond to cybersecurity threats using Artificial Intelligence. Unlike traditional signature-based systems, DeepSec uses machine learning (XGBoost) to detect anomalous behaviors in network traffic — enabling it to identify both known and unknown (zero-day) attacks.

facial-recognition-technology.title: facial recognition technology
facial-recognition-technology.description:
This project presents the design and implementation of a Real-time Face Recognition and Access Control System, aimed at revolutionizing conventional security paradigms. The system leverages advanced artificial intelligence and Internet of Things (IoT) technologies to provide an autonomous, efficient, and secure access solution. The core functionality involves real-time video streaming from an ESP32-CAM to a host server running a Flask web application. This server performs sophisticated face detection using YOLOv8-nano and identity recognition through DeepFace (utilizing Facenet512/ArcFace embeddings). Upon successful authentication of an authorized individual, the system wirelessly transmits control signals to an ESP8266 microcontroller, which actuates a physical access mechanism.
A key strength of this system is its robustness and resilience. It incorporates advanced error handling, including exponential backoff and automated reconnection strategies for camera streams, ensuring continuous operation even under network instability. The web interface offers intuitive user management, real-time visual feedback with dynamic overlays, and comprehensive access logging, enhancing administrative oversight. Empirical results demonstrate high frame rates (e.g., 10 FPS for local webcam, 40  FPS for ESP32-CAM) and a low false acceptance rate, validating its effectiveness. This project provides a cost-effective, open-source, and highly adaptable solution for smart access control, showcasing the seamless integration of AI, web technologies, and IoT.

silent-scrapers.title: Silent Scrapers
silent-scrapers.description:
The project is a web-based platform that combines a main website with a set of experimental labs containing real security vulnerabilities. The platform aims to train students and anyone interested in cybersecurity to discover and exploit vulnerabilities in a practical and safe environment, helping them gain hands-on experience and essential skills required in the job market.

In addition to the vulnerable labs, the platform also provides a suite of built-in web and network security tools that users can access directly from the browser. These tools eliminate the need for local installations, offering a seamless and lightweight experience. Whether it's scanning domains, analyzing open ports, testing firewalls, or simulating web attacks, users can perform comprehensive security assessments within a single platform — making learning both efficient and accessible from anywhere.

face-recognition-attendence-system.title: Face recognition attendence system
face-recognition-attendence-system.description:
This project presents a smart attendance system that uses artificial 
intelligence and image processing to automatically record student 
attendance without direct human involvement
It uses a camera to capture faces and compare them with a pre-
registered database, reducing errors and preventing attendance fraud
The system is integrated with a MySQL database to store data and 
includes a user-friendly graphical interface with clickable buttons for 
each topic
It also supports barcode technology as an alternative when using a 
camera is difficult
A unique QR code is generated and refreshed every three seconds to 
allow instant access to external forms
teamMembers: 3- Youssef Ali Abdel Nour Abdel Gawad
4- Abdullah Abdel Basset Shehata Abdel Azim

vidscribe.title: vidscribe
vidscribe.description:
The project primarily assists beginners in the content creation field by requiring only the desired video
title from the user and then automatically producing a complete video. This includes [Script Writing -
Resource Gathering - Voiceover - Video Editing - Final Output] The end result is a fully edited video
combining all visual elements with the voiceover track, requiring minimal input from the user while
handling the entire production workflow automatically.

facial-recognition-technology-system.title: facial recognition technology system
facial-recognition-technology-system.description:
This project presents the design and implementation of a Real-time Face Recognition and Access Control System, aimed at revolutionizing conventional security paradigms. The system leverages advanced artificial intelligence and Internet of Things (IoT) technologies to provide an autonomous, efficient, and secure access solution. The core functionality involves real-time video streaming from an ESP32-CAM to a host server running a Flask web application. This server performs sophisticated face detection using YOLOv8-nano and identity recognition through DeepFace (utilizing Facenet512/ArcFace embeddings). A key strength of this system is its robustness and resilience. It incorporates advanced error handling, including exponential backoff and automated reconnection strategies for camera streams, ensuring continuous operation even under network instability. The web interface offers intuitive user management, real-time visual feedback with dynamic overlays, and comprehensive access logging, enhancing administrative oversight. This project provides a cost-effective, open-source, and highly adaptable solution for smart access control, showcasing the seamless integration of AI, web technologies, and IoT.

my-university.title: My University
my-university.description: The project is a cross-platform digital solution for universities, streamlining academic operations such as scheduling, attendance, grades, and notifications. It supports online lectures, virtual meetings, exam hosting, and automated schedule generation using smart algorithms, aiming to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and the overall user experience.
teamMembers: Ali Esam Ali, Mahmoud Ahmed Said, Mohamed Gamel Emam, Ahmed Hassan Mohmed, Mahmoud Ahmed Khalaf, Abdelrhman Ahmed Hassan, Mariam wael edris, Hager Ramadan Abo shama, Somaia Osama Sobhy, Shimaa Adel Abo elanen, Shahd Ashraf Abdelwahed, Sohaila Salama Abdelrhman
supervisors: Dr. Marwa El Sayed  , Eng. Naglaa Saeed

unisign.title: UniSign
unisign.description: Smart glove for translating Arabic Sign Language Using characters

smart-car-parking.title: Smart car parking
smart-car-parking.description:
The project is an automated parking management system that monitors 
parking spots in real-time using IR sensors and displays availability (P1 Full/P2 
Empty) on an LCD. It controls access via RFID validation—opening a servo gate 
for valid cards or sounding a buzzer for invalid ones. An ultrasonic sensor 
detects exiting vehicles (5cm) to trigger gate opening and closes it after 
departure (30cm). Designed to optimize space, security, and traffic flow, the 
system eliminates manual checks while improving efficiency.

onyx-protection-system-ops.title: Onyx Protection System OPS
onyx-protection-system-ops.description:
The ONYX Local Network Security System is designed to 
address growing cybersecurity threats in local networks, 
particularly for small and medium businesses (SMBs).
Traditional security methods, such as password-only 
authentication, are no longer sufficient against modern 
attacks like data breaches and insider threats.
ONYX enhances security by combining multi-factor 
authentication using passwords and device MAC addresses 
with automatic file encryption and honeypot deception (e.g., 
fake login pages).
Built with Flask and Socket.IO, the system ensures secure user 
authentication, encrypted real-time messaging, and role-
based access control. Key features include:
• Two-step verification (password + approved device).
• AES-256 encryption for files (e.g., PDFs, Word docs).
• Attack detection via trap pages (spy.html) and activity 
logging.
Testing confirmed ONYX's effectiveness in blocking 
unauthorized access and protecting sensitive data. Future 
improvements could include AI-based threat detection and 
biometric authentication. This project provides a cost-
effective, scalable solution for SMBs to safeguard their 
networks.

teamLeader.name: Abd Alrhman Jamal Abd Alnaser Abd Allah

teamMembers: Abd Alrhman Jamal Abd Alnaser Abd Allah

fraud-banking-transaction-detection.title: Fraud banking transaction detection
teamMembers: AbdAllah moustafa, muhaned Karem, AbdAllah Mohamed, Mohamed sherif, omar mokhtar, omar abdelnather, adham hesham mahmoud zinhom

cybernox.title: CyberNox
cybernox.description: Conducting in-depth web application analysis using advanced cybersecurity tools, integrated with artificial intelligence to interpret the results, provide remediation suggestions, and simplify technical findings for non-technical stakeholders.

smart-guard.title: Smart Guard
smart-guard.description:
Museums are among the most prominent institutions that preserve the history and culture of peoples, housing priceless artifacts. With the increasing incidence of museum vandalism and theft, there is an urgent need to develop smart security systems that enhance the safety of these vital facilities. In this project, we propose an integrated museum security system based on modern technologies, including sensors, lasers, and cameras, along with a mobile application that links the system directly to the museum's management. This system aims to detect any theft or intrusion early and immediately alert officials, ensuring the protection of artifacts from tampering or theft.
This project aims to design and implement an integrated smart security system to secure the museum using modern technologies, including laser sensors, motion-sensitive buttons, surveillance cameras, and a mobile application that links the system directly to the museum's management. This system detects any attempted intrusion or theft early and immediately alerts officials.
The project's importance lies in its provision of a proactive solution that combines physical and digital protection, increasing the efficiency of the security system and reducing reliance on human resources. It is also suitable for implementation in various types of museums, both large and small, and enhances the preservation of cultural heritage from loss or damage.

mimicbot.title: MimicBot
mimicbot.description: This project presents a 3D-printed robotic arm capable of moving horizontally and vertically within a defined area. It interacts with users by playing games such as chess, tic-tac-toe, and rock-paper-scissors. The arm can be manually controlled via a connected program or can move in sync with the user's arm using wearable sensors. The goal of the project is to develop a versatile robotic arm that enhances human-robot interaction and serves as both an educational and entertaining tool. It integrates advanced technologies like 3D printing and biosensors to provide a hands-on learning experience. The target audience includes engineering and robotics students, educational institutions, those interested in human-machine interaction technologies, and children and teenagers seeking interactive and fun learning methods.
teamMembers: Mazen Hamada + Mohamed Ahmed + Hamaza Wael  + Mostafa Hussein + Youssef Adel + Lavina Osama + Jasmine Ehab + Sara Sayed + Mirna Mostafa

aegis-ai.title: AEGIS-AI
aegis-ai.description: Aegis AI is a full web-based system designed, built, trained, and deployed from scratch to detect and classify online threats in real time, powered by a custom-trained DistilBERT-based NLP model using a curated dataset of 7,500 text samples across 14 categories (13 threat types + 1 safe), integrated via a Flask API with a simple HTML/CSS/JS front-end, utilizing VirusTotal API for link analysis, and publicly hosted on Hugging Face Spaces to provide users with a smart, accessible, and effective cybersecurity tool.
supervisors: Dr. Sayed El far -- Eng. Amany

smart--ai-firewall.title: Smart  AI-Firewall
smart--ai-firewall.description: The "Smart Firewall" project aims to develop and detect cyber attacks such as DDoS, brute force, malware, and portscan using an AI-trained model. This model automatically detects attacks in real time and sends alerts via the interface to network administrators.
teamMembers: Mahmoud A ulqadir ,  Amr Gamal , Abdelrahman Ahmed, Mohamed Mohamed Atia , Ahmed mahmoud  , belal saed , Ahmed hosniy , Anas Mohamed fathy

max-ai-agent.title: Max Ai Agent
max-ai-agent.description:
MAX is a modular AI assistant powered by GPT
4o-mini and integrated into Telegram via N8N. It 
features specialized agents for tasks like email, 
calendar, and content management. With 
contextual memory and a multi-agent system, 
MAX offers smart, adaptive, and efficient 
automation to boost productivity and reduce
supervisors: dr. Abdel Salam Helmy  / eng.habiba hamid

bobby-fischer.title: Bobby fischer
bobby-fischer.description: A chess robotic arm that is capable of playing chess against a human using computer vision and inverse kalematics and Ai chess algorithm to make it able to play chess and we also added an easy interface web application and a mobile application as well that u can play offline chess and also against the computer itself and we also added a learning chess academy for both the the web and the app there is also Information about the history of chess legends and about there techniques so this is not just an entertainment robotic arm its also for learning and knowing more about the game

yallachat.title: Yallachat
yallachat.description: This project proposes the development of a mobile messaging application called YallaChat, aiming to provide a secure, fast, and user-friendly platform for real-time communication.
yallachat.video: This project proposes the development of a mobile messaging application called YallaChat, aiming to provide a secure, fast, and user-friendly platform for real-time communication.

scanova.title: Scanova
scanova.description: Scanova is a web application security scanner designed to identify and report security vulnerabilities. Featuring a modern design and an intuitive graphical user interface, Scanova enables security experts, developers, IT teams, penetration testers, and vulnerability hunters to proactively detect security threats before they are exploited. Scanova combines active and passive scanning techniques to perform comprehensive security assessments for a wide range of vulnerability categories, including SQL injections, cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, CSRF attacks, file inclusion vulnerabilities, and many more. Thanks to its modular design, Scanova provides the flexibility to choose specific security tests to run based on project requirements.

alphaheart.title: AlphaHeart
alphaheart.description: This project introduces a smart system for vital signs monitoring, medical appointment booking, locating nearby hospitals and pharmacies, and simplifying communication between doctors and patients. It includes a device measuring heart rate, body temperature, and ambient temperature. Data is sent to a mobile app and website, accessible to all users regardless of device ownership.

text-to-speech.title: Text to Speech
text-to-speech.description: A smart text-to-speech system that analyzes written messages, detects the sentiment (positive, negative, neutral), identifies the topic, and reads the results using natural-sounding speech. The goal is to help users and companies quickly understand large amounts of written feedback. We built both a web application and an offline desktop app with a simple interface, where users can interact with the system easily. The project also includes educational sections to learn about speech processing and NLP techniques. This is not just a technical project, it’s also designed for learning and real-world use.

smart-glove.title: Smart Glove
smart-glove.description: This project introduces a Smart Glove designed to translate sign language into spoken and written human language using advanced sensor technology and AI. The glove integrates Flex sensors and an MPU6050 sensor to capture numerical representations of hand gestures. These readings are processed by a trained AI model capable of predicting corresponding letters or words. A Flask-based backend handles the translation and delivers output to a responsive web interface supporting both Arabic and English languages, including text-to-speech functionality. Communication between the glove and the web interface is achieved over Wi-Fi via an ESP32 microcontroller, assuming both are connected to the same local network. A CSV dataset within the project enables accurate mapping of sensor input to meaningful text.

fire-fighting-robot.title: Fire Fighting Robot
fire-fighting-robot.description:
The Fire Fighting Robot is an intelligent robotic system designed to detect and extinguish fires in indoor environments safely and efficiently. The robot relies on sensors such as flame and temperature sensors (MLX90614) to identify the presence of fire and operates in two modes:
	•	Automatic mode: The robot detects the fire on its own and activates the extinguishing mechanism (water pump or fan).
	•	Manual mode: The robot can be controlled remotely via Bluetooth using a mobile phone.

The system is built using an Arduino Mega microcontroller, DC motors, flame and temperature sensors, a servo motor, a water pump, and a relay module, all powered by rechargeable batteries. The code is written in C/C++ using the Arduino IDE.

The goal of the project is to provide a practical and intelligent solution for early fire response, reducing risks to human life and property in hazardous environments

smart-ai-hospital-system.title: Smart AI Hospital System
smart-ai-hospital-system.description:
This project delivers an intelligent, fully integrated hospital‑management platform that unifies administrative and clinical operations on a single digital backbone. It supports multilingual workflows (Arabic, English, and more) and offers comprehensive handling of personal details, medical records, specialist notes, laboratory results, radiology images, and longitudinal health data. Patients log in to secure personal dashboards to review their complete records, while authorised staff manage doctors, nurses, emergency physicians, ICU teams, lab and radiology technicians, and administrative users through role‑based access controls.

A flagship capability is the Smart Emergency Request: one press of the SOS button on a patient’s dashboard transmits a real‑time alert—with live geolocation—to the hospital’s emergency desk. Staff immediately see the patient’s full profile and can dispatch an appropriate medical team to the reported location.

Key features include:
• Multilingual user interface
• End‑to‑end patient, doctor, and staff management
• Live‑location emergency alerts
• Digital patient profiles (reports, labs, imaging)
• Role‑based permissions (admin, doctor, nurse, etc.)
• Modern 3‑D‑style user experience
• Scalable architecture suitable for hospitals, clinics, and health centres
